wikipedia_page.main: Robert Idwal Davies (17 August 1899 – 7 June 1980) was a Welsh amateur footballer who played as a centre-forward for various clubs in the 1920s including brief spells with Southport and Bolton Wanderers in the Football League. He also made six appearances in amateur internationals for Wales and one full international appearance against Scotland in 1923.

response: *Idwal Davies (1899–1980), a Wales and Bolton Wanderers footballer, was born in nearby Ewloe Green.
* Robert Idwal Davies (footballer) (1899–1980), Bolton Wanderers F.C. and Wales international footballer
Notable people named Idwal Davies include:
*Idwal Davies (rugby) (1915–1990), a Welsh dual-code rugby player
